alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 8:28PM CDT until March 30 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Lyon. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 826 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing street flooding in Americus. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Emporia, Americus, Reading and Admire.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
